topic.title: Just A Shout Out To The Other Non-Conspiracy/Rationalists Out There
topic.body:
I've noticed that there is a lot of conspiracy mumbo jumbo on here as of late, and I just wanted to give a shout out to all the people that haven't used this platform for spreading nonsense.
Oh, and for those that do believe the world is coming to and end every ten years, nonstop, without any results... you can just dismiss me as a "government illumunati-freemason-jewish-manchurian-candidate-communist-socialist-satanis-pagan-space-lizard-person-new-world-orderist-whatever"... the same as your social worker.

topic.title: I'm going to unbaptise all of you, vaccinate you, take away your guns and flags, and train you to be tolerant of Muslims and the Mainstream Media
topic.body:
I'm also going to turn your frogs gay and get rid of all your drugs and alcohol.
And there's nothing you can do about it.
Hail Marx! Hail Satan!

Who ye' be?

1584527258_1HeEWnYs69J1BV4P4niDN775yBVqN.body:
Nonsense.

35713 infected cases in Italy per WHO
https://experience.arcgis.com/experience/685d0ace521648f8a5beeeee1b9125cd

41,035 infected cases in Italy per John Hopkins
https://gisanddata.maps.arcgis.com/apps/opsdashboard/index.html#/bda7594740fd40299423467b48e9ecf6

Italy has a population of 60.48 Million according to the United Nations and Eurostat.

Therefore, at an absolutely worst case scenario, the infection rate is 0.06%

(41,035 is 0.06% of 60.68 million)

The recovery rate is 97% and the most common cause of death is pneumonia related.

Why is it conspiracy theorists are always bad at math?

Do you guys seriously not know how to perform percentage calculations?

This isn't hard.

And where are you getting all of your numbers from? You're not showing citations or your math.

1585133073_1G9k2b4cSRzZSfLQuzxmpJB3LT3Gf.body: They all depend of the economy. Your conspiracy theory is baseless. It is true that the systems are built of bias and greed, but most of the players involved actually believe in their own biases. They have no understood the importance of prioritizing epistemology and error elimination from their thinking and actions. Stage One for improvement would be an Epistemic Revolution. Stage Two would be placing importance on accuracy and Justice. Stage Three would be maths-based delineation of sections of the economy, education and services. This is the true Trinity of The Future.

1587734994_1GLrPVFs91nhs2HYnxZj8BXL8pYSd.body:
Just a clarification:

I'm talking about these conspiracy theories that are peddled on here:
- PizzaGate
- Covid is a hoax/Covid was engineered
- Vaccines are bad
- Chemtrails
- Doomsday is upon us
- Government is planning mass exterminations/euthanasia
- Governments and corporations are planning on enteral martial law
...and so on.

I'm not talking about:
- People are dicks
- People lie
- Gov and Corps cheat, manipulate and spy on people
- General corruption
...that's just an axiomatic given.

Some people see the latter and immediately jump to the conclusions of the former because someone had weaved some tales. Some people are more willing to play into the tales of people for various reasons; be it an ignorance of fallacies, biases or whatever. And the more people feed their confirmation bias with more tales, the more they step away from evidence based thinking and more towards narrative based thinking, pairing it with the argument from ignorance or the argument from silence.

Not the healthiest of mindsets.

> [commandantecero](#comment_13_1NG5ezregpGPUFoJuJfVZLW98B2zed5yro): That's true, and there is no reason to make the jump to "PizzaGate" from "a well-connected pedophile who owns a pizzeria was abusing children there and allowing others to do the same" or "Covid was an engineered bioweapon" from "The Chinese were screwing around with something that endangered us all." [...]

"PizzaGate" has been thoroughly debunked.
https://rationalwiki.org/wiki/Pizzagate

"Bioweapon Covid 19" has also been debunked.
https://rationalwiki.org/wiki/2019-20_COVID-19_outbreak#Claims_that_the_virus_was_engineered

> [commandantecero](#comment_13_1NG5ezregpGPUFoJuJfVZLW98B2zed5yro): On the other hand it is equally erroneous to take it the other way, that because these things are associated with conspiracy theories that do not withstand logical analysis none of it must be true.

Someone obviously doesn't understand how the burden of proof works or what a false dilemma fallacy is.

> [commandantecero](#comment_13_1NG5ezregpGPUFoJuJfVZLW98B2zed5yro): I am sure that
Sure, how exactly? Do you have sufficient evidence? You do realize you can have a hypothesis without being sure, right?

> [commandantecero](#comment_13_1NG5ezregpGPUFoJuJfVZLW98B2zed5yro): Likewise that there are governments and people in our government that would be OK with martial law and extermination, and I know that from history.

So, because something has happened in the past, it must be likely to occur in the present? Even though the logistics are entirely different now, as are our situations, politically, socially, technologically and education wise?

Hmm... doesn't past the smell test.

> [commandantecero](#comment_13_1NG5ezregpGPUFoJuJfVZLW98B2zed5yro): Cosby, Spacey, Epstein and Weinstein... dismissed as a conspiracy.

Citation needed. Hollywood has been known as a festering strew of abuse for decades, which is why the "casting couch" cliche exists. No one denied it; it just takes actual evidence and a lack of bias in the system to persecute. That doesn't mean it makes sense to jump to conclusions based on intuition. All beliefs require evidence.

> [commandantecero](#comment_13_1NG5ezregpGPUFoJuJfVZLW98B2zed5yro): So I'm willing to wade through all of it and see how much is real.

Make sense, but are you aware of epistemic differentials? Do you know of Venn's Circles of Doubt and Evidence? Venn borrowed the idea of Eulerian Circles (aka Euler Diagrams) for the purpose of differentiating Rational Implications and Irrational Implications.
I would suggest studying this, because you seem to be lacking in an understanding of why Narrative Based Conclusions are Irrational and Evidence Based Conclusions are Rational.

1624761447_17AMQVbBa12XB3xFWKDnP2dCEx92T.body:
> [qwyx](#comment_4_12sEK7ur84yYok3iWWPxZUvZd4YqjuQG9f): Zeronet can only be turned off in conjunction with the internet . :)

That's not even remotely true. Decentralized doesn't mean control-proof. First of all, people aren't obfuscated by ZeroNet by default, and secondly Tor nodes are all tapped by intelligence networks. Everyone could be identified and shut down one by one. They did it with Anom and other apps before.

Additionally, ISPs can actually restrict ports and protocols. Try as people might there is no fool proof way to set up connections that can't be traced or limited unless people are always on the move.

Hell, even the Government dropped TOR in the public's lap after they realized those users there were the more they were able to blend in making more difficult (but impossible) to track and identify people.

The easiest way to do this from a static location is to use a prepaid phone with HotSpot capabilities, store it in a close but separate location, and then have a separate device that is only used for obfuscated activity.

Even then people can still be identified with "Deep Metadata" which includes everything from personal typing/language choices, time windows of use, username themes, etc.

The sad part is that you'd have to be unreasonably paranoid to live in the Western World and care that much... or otherwise you'd have to be engaged in activity you know you shouldn't be.

Damn Government! If I wanted you to know the location of mister socky, I'd send it to you with my annual "i REFUSE to pay taxes and bathe!" letter during tax season (whenever that may be).

1630241491_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac.body:
Do you seriously need someone to post a timeline?
The West invaded the Middle East numerous times; and the more recent bullshit started during the Cold War because the Middle East was between Russia and the West.
So the Russians armed them and gave them money while the West tried to supplant their leadership.
This is why they had until the 2000s outdated Russian rifles but American embassies and military bases.
The whole "oil" this is mostly bullshit; American Military and Arab militants capture oil fields in the Middle East in hope of supplying the American military presence in the Middle East with oil (trucks, jeeps, etc).
Do you really think the USA has been there for 50 years sending troops American oil?
The USA is still there for that reason; it's a strategic point. It  has nothing to do with money, oil, resources, religion or ideology.
And the Arabs want everyone out. Seeing both the West and Russia act like complete dipshits actually resulted in the Middle East dropping from it's Westernesque culture to what it is now as a result of blowback.
Blow up enough areas while throwing your aggressive lifestyle in a local's face, they'll join a lifestyle that is the exact opposite out of (flawed) principal.
Everyone is wrong in this. The Western terrorists, the Russia terrorists and the Middle Eastern terrorists.

Gather around kids, here is a history lesson:
Due to the Cold War, both The West and Russia/China wanted to take space up in Strategic Spots spots around the Globe. Since The Middle East is between The West and The East (Russia/China), it became a potential spot for destabilization and control.
This is why up until recently Middle East Terrorist Groups had Russian Rifles and American Jeeps.
Proxy Wars were funded so that both sides could fight for Strategic Spots.
I know, people have heard it was all about the oil, but oil was the least of everyone's concerns.
This was about Nuclear War and World War III prepping.
The problem was that while Russia and China placated to the local extremists as a control tactic, The West tried for force Western Culture on the local extremists.
And most of the money that was being used for ops came from the American and British Taxpayers.
So they have waged war on both the Governments and the Civilians that do not protest the ways the extremists and general local populations have been treated.
The Religious Aspect is just local people clinging to a local tradition to explain why they are trying to "protect" local lives, but then it got out of control, as religious extremism often does, and thus they start attacking their own people branding them as traitors.
Muslims and Christians were actually not enemies at all during the Crusades; there were small wars, but generally they traded with each other.
The modern extremism came about after the fall of the Ottoman Empire when The West, particularly France and Britain tried to take over Northern Africa, the Middle East and India.
They mistreated locals, and thus there was blow back.

1630436341_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2.body:
It appears the minds behind ZeroNet and ZeroID have no idea what they're doing in regards to basic automation.
They should be able to clear, post and call via bash, but alas I believe we're not dealing with a full pack of cards here.
If this was entirely GUI or entirely CLI, it would make sense, so that usage was streamlines, but asking users to mess around with files while also asking them to use the app as GUI... is asking for trouble.
This is why all other apps that use a GUI browser interface always just have a CONFIG menu allowing for simple alterations.
Asking people to muck about with editing, modifying, etc... while also restricting username registration to one account per ip/machine... so there is no possibility of a complete reset/restart from scratch?
Not a smart move.

1633895520_1BFxHVXHTKcnWLWPVKbTknZTAaiHz.body:
ZeroNet isn't part of the Dark Web. In fact, by default it doesn't even use TOR or proxies.
This is a bunch of meaningless word salad.
You also don't need special tech to "map" ZeroNet. It's a decentralized system, so directories are copied to everyone in a list, and then the data is replicated from multiple sources well called to post.
Do you not know how this works? It's exactly like torrents, just reworked for web posts.

> [7uz8yu7gxwnhfgae](#comment_16_1CN7STVMU29Rme1tgVRRPj3ZA3H7m99Rei): (yawn) Just do your part to seed it glowie. We need the better hardware you bring to the table.

You do realize glowie is a meme, right? The federal government doesn't have people wasting time on sites that aren't about terrorism or extremism. I've reported a few knuckleheads to the FBI because they posted threats, but other than that, if you believe everyone that disagrees with you is an agent, then you're daft.
They don't have the time or budget to waste on people because of their "views" alone.
